encyclopedia.content: 名词解释 n. 1.珩，珩科鸟锛埲绶锿仿蠹︼級 [英] [ˈplʌvə] [美] [ˈplʌvɚ, ˈplovɚ 1.He wondered if the ploverwas the fastest bird. 他想知道千鸟是不是最快的鸟。 2.large crested Old World ploverhaving wattles and spurs. 东半球长肉垂和刺壮物的大型有羽冠的鸻。 3.large plover-like sandpiper of North American fields and uplands. 北美旷野

entry.def: A plover is a bird with a rounded body, a short tail, and a short beak that is found by the sea or by lakes.

means.word_mean: 1. any of numerous chiefly shorebirds of relatively compact build having straight bills and large pointed wings; closely related to the sandpipers
